repo_notes.content: SECURITY NOTICE: This repository contains NO credentials or connection strings. All database configuration (DATABASE_URL, TIMESCALE_DATABASE_URL) is managed exclusively through Vercel environment variables. The .env.local file is gitignored. Do NOT document any environment variable values, passwords, or connection strings.
For local development, developers must configure their own Vercel project and pull environment variables using 'vercel env pull'. No credentials should ever appear in documentation.

pages.title: Getting Started
pages.purpose: Installation and running the development server

page_notes.content: Run 'npm install' then 'npm run dev'. Environment variables are configured via Vercel dashboard - use 'vercel env pull' for local development. Never commit .env files.

pages.title: Development Guide
pages.purpose: Guide for developers working on the project

page_notes.content: All environment configuration is managed through Vercel. No credentials are stored in the repository.

Clone the repository and run 'npm install'. For environment variables, connect to Vercel using 'vercel link' then 'vercel env pull .env.local'. All secrets are managed in Vercel dashboard - never commit credentials to the repository. The .env.local file is in .gitignore.
Deployed via Vercel with automatic CI/CD. Production environment variables are configured in Vercel dashboard.
Uses TimescaleDB for time-series data. Connection string is stored in Vercel environment variables (DATABASE_URL). No credentials in codebase.
